notes: Bird perched on newly constructed nest
"common breeding resident, avoids thick jungle and remains near scrubby unclutivated patches and tea plantaionsin flocks of up to 10, near or away from human habitation."

Egg laying is said to occur between January to March. The bird is common around the cultivated lands in the vicinity of Ootacamund, Coonoor and Kotaghery. A specimen from Coonoor is dated 23rd august.- Hume
2 nests recorded, flocks of up to 50 birds seen during winter
